revised_title: Davydov Solitons in Polypeptides: A Quantum Mechanical Analysis
tldr: This article explores Davydov soliton theory, which explains the self-trapping of molecular vibrational energy in polypeptides, specifically in crystalline acetanilide. The author reviews the experimental evidence for this phenomenon and discusses the quantum mechanical analysis of the self-trapping process. The findings have implications for understanding energy storage and transport in proteins and biological organisms.
